prompt:

For EACH market:
1. Estimate the TRUE PROBABILITY based on news context
2. Calculate EDGE vs market price
3. Only recommend trades with 10%+ edge


Market 1:
Title: Will the highest temperature in London be 9°C on December 13?
Current Market Price: 90.0% (this is the market's implied probability)
Recent trade: $622.70 on No
Link: https://polymarket.com/event/highest-temperature-in-london-on-december-13

📰 WEB SEARCH CONTEXT:
On December 13, 2025, London is expected to experience a high temperature of approximately 9°C (48°F). The day's forecast indicates sunny conditions with a high of 9°C and a low of 5°C. ([datetimeonline.com](https://www.datetimeonline.com/weather/uk/london?utm_source=openai))

Historically, December 13 in London has seen higher temperatures. The record high for this date is 13.3°C (56°F), recorded in 1901. ([extremeweatherwatch.com](https://www.extremeweatherwatch.com/cities/london-on/record-high-by-day?utm_source=openai)) However, the average high temperature for December in London is around 7.8°C (46°F). ([weather-atlas.com](https://www.weather-atlas.com/en/united-kingdom/london-weather-december?utm_source=openai))

In recent years, London has experienced warmer December temperatures. For instance, in December 2021, the highest temperature recorded was 16.3°C (61°F). ([extremeweatherwatch.com](https://www.extremeweatherwatch.com/cities/london-on/record-high-by-day?utm_source=openai))

Looking ahead, David Harbour has teased a significant development for Hopper in the series fin

Provide predictions in the exact format specified.
system_prompt:
You are a prediction market expert analyzing Polymarket markets.
You have been provided with RECENT NEWS AND CONTEXT for each market from web search.

IMPORTANT: For each market, you MUST estimate the TRUE PROBABILITY of the outcome.
Compare your probability estimate to the market price to find EDGE (mispricing).

Edge = Your Probability - Market Probability
- Positive edge on YES side means market undervalues YES
- Negative edge means market overvalues YES (bet NO instead)

For each market, provide your prediction in this EXACT format:

MARKET [number]: [decision]
Your Probability: [0-100]%
Market Price: [shown price]%
Edge: [+/-X]% (Your prob - Market)
Expected Value: [calculate: Edge × potential payout]
Reasoning: [1-2 sentences explaining your probability estimate]

Decision must be one of: YES, NO, or NO_TRADE
- YES = Your probability > Market price + 10% (minimum 10% edge)
- NO = Your probability < Market price - 10%
- NO_TRADE = Edge < 10% (not enough value)

Be contrarian when you have conviction. Look for markets where news hasn't been priced in yet.
consensus_summary: The consensus strongly recommends betting on Team Tidebound in Market 2, with all four AIs agreeing on a significant positive edge. For Markets 1 and 3, the majority advise against trading, though there is sharp disagreement on Market 1's true probability, with two AIs suggesting a "NO" bet while others see insufficient edge. Overall, only Market 2 presents a clear, agreed-upon trading opportunity based on the provided analysis.
